function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"AI-enabled technology dependency for diagnosis may lead to misdiagnosis or missed diagnoses due to technological errors or limitations.","Impact":"Misdiagnosis or missed diagnoses can lead to delayed treatment or improper management of contagious diseases, leading to increased spread and severity of the disease.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and verification of the AI algorithms, training of healthcare professionals to actively verify AI-enabled diagnoses, and having alternate diagnostic methods in place.","Technologies":"Regular software updates, quality assurance protocols, and continuous monitoring of AI algorithms.","People":"Healthcare professionals, patients, and public health stakeholders.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, healthcare technology providers, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Increased dependence on telemedicine may lead to communication errors, misinterpretation of symptoms, and ineffective triage of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Incorrect triage and management of contagious diseases can lead to the spread of the disease and delayed treatment for patients in need.","Mitigation":"Standardization of telemedicine processes, training of healthcare providers in effective telemedicine communication, and regular evaluation of telemedicine performance.","Technologies":"Telehealth software with built-in communication and diagnostic tools, secure messaging platforms for patient-provider communication.","People":"Healthcare providers, patients, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, telemedicine service providers, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequate data privacy and security measures in telemedicine platforms may lead to unauthorized access to sensitive health information and potential exposure of contagious disease status.","Impact":"Unauthorized access to health information can lead to breaches of patient confidentiality, stigmatization, and discrimination based on contagious disease status.","Mitigation":"Implementation of strong data security measures, encryption of patient data, regular security audits, and patient education on data privacy.","Technologies":"End-to-end encryption, secure authentication methods, data access controls, and secure storage systems for health data.","People":"Patients, healthcare providers, and public health stakeholders.","Owner":"Telemedicine service providers, healthcare institutions, and public health organizations."}]}
